key_title: Key to the species of Lolium

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemmas with an awn at least 4 mm long
Lemmas unawned or with awns less than 3 mm
Rachis slender (c. 1 mm diam.); florets not swollen, more than 3 times as long as broad; glume shorter than spikelet
Rachis stout (c. 2 mm diam.); florets swollen at maturity, c. 3 times as long as broad; glume subequal to spikelet
Florets not swollen at maturity, at least 5 times as long as broad
Florets swollen at maturity, c. 3 times as long as broad
Glume at least three-quarters as long as spikelet; leaves convolute when young; annual or biennial
Glume from c. one-half to three-quarters as long as spikelet; leaves flat or folded when young; perennial
Glume longer than spikelet; rachis longer than the remainder of the culm at maturity; plants to 30 cm high; stems not or rarely reddish, or if so, then nodes not conspicuously darker
Glume generally shorter than spikelet; rachis shorter than the remainder of the culm at maturity; stems reddish, conspicuously darker at nodes
